A portable charger is a must-have to keep your devices powered throughout the day, and a reusable water bottle ensures you stay hydrated on the go. Consider bringing a travel pillow and noise-canceling headphones for added comfort on long flights or train rides. Managing Money While Traveling: Credit Cards, Cash, and Apps Avoid unnecessary fees by using a travel-friendly credit card with no foreign transaction fees and withdrawing cash from ATMs that offer fair exchange rates. It’s always a good idea to carry a small amount of local currency for places that don’t accept cards. If you’re traveling long-term, consider using international banking apps that help manage your money across different currencies.
